text.text: While at GE: Digital, my primary project has been building px-vis, a charting library for the Predix design system.

Px-vis itself is a set of semi-standalone web components with which, one can build charts. From these building blocks, I and my collegue have built a number of reusable, customizable chart components, including the following types of charts:

Px-vis includes a series of novel features, such as hybrid svg-canvas charts, using web workers for data processing, a specialized canvas renderer to maintain 60fps frame rate, and a customizable toolbar allowing end developer hooks to create custom interactions on the chart.
One of the greatest challenges in creating this charting library is creating an open system allowing end developers who consume our web components a high degree of customization.
